properties.Name: ShipmentItem
properties.Description: The lines on a shipment each consisting of one item.

Columns.Name: ShipmentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentItemNumber
Columns.Description: The shipment line number.

Columns.Name: PackingInstructions
Columns.Description: Packing instructions for the associated shipped item.

Columns.Name: HandlingInstructions
Columns.Description:
Written instructions provided by the shipper/manufacturer and designed to
ensure proper handling of the cargo. This can be in the form of marks (see Cautionary Markings) on the cargo or packaging itself or in a separate document such as the bill of lading.

Columns.Name: CountryOfManufactureName
Columns.Description: The country of manufacture of the item.

Columns.Name: ShippedItemQuantity
Columns.Description: The quantity of items shipped.

Columns.Name: OrderId
Columns.Description: The unique number that identifies an Order.

Columns.Name: OrderLineNumber
Columns.Description: The number that identifies the Order Line Item.

Columns.Name: TransactionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction.

Columns.Name: TransactionLineItemId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier that identifies the Transaction Line Item.

Columns.Name: ItemNetWeight
Columns.Description: The weight of the Item.

Columns.Name: WeightUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: ItemLength
Columns.Description: The length of the Item.

Columns.Name: ItemWidth
Columns.Description: The width of the Item.

Columns.Name: ItemHeight
Columns.Description: The height of the Item.

Columns.Name: LengthWidthHeightUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: Volume
Columns.Description: The volume of the shipment item.

Columns.Name: VolumeUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: PerItemWeight
Columns.Description: The individual or per item weight of an item.

Columns.Name: TotalQuantityItemWeight
Columns.Description: The total weight of all the items without additional packaging weights added.

Columns.Name: PerItemPackagedWeight
Columns.Description: The weight of each item packaged for shipment.

Columns.Name: TotalQuantityPackagedWeight
Columns.Description: The total weight of all items packaged for shipment.

Columns.Name: PerItemDimensionalWeight
Columns.Description: The per item dimensional weight, which is the conversion of the cubic space of a shipment into pounds. Commonly referred to as dim weight. The international term is volume weight.

Columns.Name: TotalQuantityDimensionalWeight
Columns.Description: The dimensional weight of all items, which is the conversion of the cubic space of a shipment into pounds. Commonly referred to as dim weight. T

Columns.Name: ActualGrossShipmentWeight
Columns.Description: The weight of the shipment including all packing, blocking, platforms, special bracing, etc., if required. (includes weight of unit load device, when applicable.)

Columns.Name: TotalItemChargeableWeight
Columns.Description: The weight of the shipment used in determining airfreight charges. The chargeable weight may be the dimensional weight, or on container shipments, the gross weight of the shipment less the tare weight of the container.

Columns.Name: TotalItemsDensity
Columns.Description: Density is weight per unit of volume. Density is computer by dividing a shipments weight by its cubic volume. Generally expressed in pounds per cubic foot in the U.S.

Columns.Name: TotalItemsDimensionalWeight
Columns.Description: A computed weight based on a minimum density requirement. It is used to determine the freight charges for low dense shipments. It is computed by dividing the shipment volume by the minimum density requirement. The Dimensional Weight Rule was developed to insure fair compensation for low-density shipments. When a given shipment falls below the minimum density requirement, dimensional weight rather than actual weight is used to calculate the transportation charged. Minimum density requirements vary from carrier to carrier. Some carriers give discounts for shipments of high-density goods.

Columns.Name: ShipmentItemNetWeight
Columns.Description: Weight of the goods alone without any immediate wrappings, e.g., the weight of the contents of a tin can without the weight of the can.

Columns.Name: PerUnitDeclaredValueForCarriageAmount
Columns.Description:
The value of goods declared to the carrier by the shipper for the purposes of determining charges of or establishing the limit of the carrier's liability for loss, damage, or delay.  See Valuation Charges.

The value of goods declared to the carrier by the shipper for the purposes of determining charges or establishing the limit of the carrier's liability for loss, damage, or delay.

Columns.Name: PerUnitDeclaredValueForCustomsAmount
Columns.Description: Declared Value for Customs    The selling price of the contents or the replacement cost if the contents are not for resale.  The amount mush be equal to or greater than the declared value.

Columns.Name: SpecialHandlingStatement
Columns.Description: A statement regarding any special handling requirements.

Columns.Name: EstimatedValue
Columns.Description: The estimated value of the shipment item(s).

Columns.Name: WarningInformationText
Columns.Description: The text of the warning label, if any, appearing upon the shipment item.

Columns.Name: AwkwardCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo of irregular size that can either be containerized (packed in container) or non-containerized (without equipment associated with) during transportation. It requires prior approval on a case by case basis before confirmation of booking.

Columns.Name: BreakBulkCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Goods shipped loose in the vessel's hold and not in a container.

Columns.Name: PerishableCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo subject to decay or deterioration.

Columns.Name: BreakBulkItemIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo which is not containerized due to its weight and/or size e.g. steel pipes, boats etc.

Columns.Name: DangerousGoodsIndicator
Columns.Description:
Items capable of presenting a risk to the health or safety of people or property when shipped.

The term used by I.M.C.O. for hazardous materials which are capable of posing a significant risk to health, safety or property while being transported.

The United Nation's official term for Hazardous Materials.  Articles or substances which are capable of posing a significant risk to the health or safety of the general public when transported by air and which are classified according to the most current editions of the ICAO Technical Instructions for the Safe Transport of Dangerous Goods by Air and the IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations.  See Hazardous Materials.

Columns.Name: HazardousMaterialHazmatIndicator
Columns.Description: Hazardous materials (Hazmat)    The U.S. Government's official term for Dangerous Goods.  Items of freight that are inherently harmful and classified under Title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (CFR).  Hazardous Materials may only be transported under certain conditions relative to packaging, quantity carried, airplane type, location on board the airplane, etc., and in conformance with applicable rules.  Also see Dangerous Goods.

Columns.Name: OversizedCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Unusually large or heavy cargo that will not fit in the cargo areas of standard-body freighters or passenger airplanes.  Cargo the exceeds the standard dimensions of common ULDs

Columns.Name: BulkCargoIndicator
Columns.Description:
Loose cargo, not unitized, not loaded in containers or on pallets.

Air Cargo:  Cargo loaded as loose pieces into airplane compartments.

Columns.Name: ArticlesOfExtraordinaryValueIndicator
Columns.Description:
Commodities identified as high value items.

Commodities identified as high-value items that require advance arrangements and special handling.

Columns.Name: AttractiveMerchandiseIndicator
Columns.Description: Commodities such as cameras, radios, electronic equipment, etc., that are handled as high-value shipments but not rated the same.

Columns.Name: PerishableItemIndicator
Columns.Description: A commodity possessing a quality or condition making it conducive to deterioration, spoilage, or death. Examples of this are seafood, flowers, fruits, vegetables and other perishable foodstuff.

Columns.Name: SerializedItemIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Item is serialized.

Columns.Name: TrackSerialNumberIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Item must be tracked by Serial Number.

Columns.Name: HoldForPickUpAtDestinationIndicator
Columns.Description: Freight to be held at the carrier's destination location for pick-up by the recipient. See also Notify on Arrival.

Columns.Name: CyCfsCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo loaded in a full container by a shipper at origin, delivered to pier facility at destination, and then devanned by the carrier for loose pick up.

Columns.Name: CyCyCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo loaded by the shipper in a full container at origin and delivered to the carrier's terminal at destination for pick up intact by consignee.

Columns.Name: DryCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo that does not require temperature control.

Columns.Name: PersonalEffectivesItemsIndicator
Columns.Description: Shipments of used personal goods not for resale.

Columns.Name: BondedFreightIndicator
Columns.Description: Freight moving under a bond to U.S. Customs or to the Internal Revenue Service, and to be delivered only under stated conditions.

Columns.Name: BulkCargoShipmentItemIndicator
Columns.Description: Not in packages or containers; shipped loose in the hold of a ship without mark and count." Grain, coal and sulfur are usually bulk freight.

Columns.Name: ControlledAtmosphereRequiredIndicator
Columns.Description: An atmosphere in which oxygen, carbon dioxide and nitrogen concentrations are regulated, as well as temperature and humidity.

Columns.Name: ContainerizableCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo that will fit into a container and result in an economical shipment.

Columns.Name: DangerousAndHazardousCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Abbreviation for "Dangerous and Hazardous" cargo.

Columns.Name: LoosePackingShipmentItemIndicator
Columns.Description: Without packing.

Columns.Name: OverheightCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo more than eight feet high which thus cannot fit into a standard container.

Columns.Name: LooseCargoIndicator
Columns.Description: Air cargo delivered to an airline as separate packages and loaded and unloaded onto airplanes (or ULDs) by airline employees, and then delivered as separate pieces to the consigned.  See Bulk Cargo.

Columns.Name: BandedPackingIndicator
Columns.Description: Cargo wrapped and/or secured with metal or plastic strips

Columns.Name: GuaranteedFreightIndicator
Columns.Description: Freight charges which are not paid to the carrier in advance of shipment but which the shipper promises to pay within a specified period of time. Guaranteed freight is considered earned by the carrier at the time of shipment and must be paid even if the cargo is undelivered or delivered damaged. Guaranteed freight is not refundable by the carrier even if they do not deliver the cargo except through subrogation proceedings.

Columns.Name: ItemSafetyClassificationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Item Safety Classification.

Columns.Name: IdentificationMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Identification Method.

Columns.Name: FreightConditionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an descriptive Freight Condition.

Columns.Name: HazardSeverityCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Hazard Severity Category.

Columns.Name: CommodityTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Commodity Type.

Columns.Name: HtsScheduleBCode
Columns.Description: The unique code identifying items within the HTS Schedule B.

Columns.Name: HarmonizedTariffScheduleCode
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an HTS Code.

Columns.Name: EccnNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a ECCN.

Columns.Name: ItemSku
Columns.Description: The Stock Keeping Unit identifier, which is typically used for inventory-related activities.

Columns.Name: CargoTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Cargo Type.

Columns.Name: LandedCost
Columns.Description: The total cost of the item once it has arrived at the buyer's door.

Columns.Name: PalletTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Pallet Type.

Columns.Name: PalletSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The serial number of the Pallet.

Columns.Name: IncotermId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Incoterm.

Columns.Name: ContainerId
Columns.Description:
The unique identifier of the container.

This would be the 'serial number' of the container if it is serialized.

Properties.Description: The lines on a shipment each consisting of one item.
